snippet: Large investors had sued 12 of the world’s largest banks for conspiring to unfairly control a derivatives market at the center of the financial crisis.
abstract: Big banks will pay $1.865 billion to settle charges they unfairly conspired to control derivatives market at center of financial crisis; banks have faced headwinds since buying and selling credit default swaps.
lead_paragraph: Large investors had sued 12 of the world’s largest banks for conspiring to unfairly control a derivatives market at the center of the financial crisis.

headline.main: Banks to Settle With Investors in Suit Over Financial Crisis
headline.print_headline: Banks to Settle With Investors in Suit Over Crisis
